item.title: Create Solr Core with Config
item.description: In the example below, "drupal_solr_conf" is in /var/www/sites/example.com 1sudo su solr 2cd /var/www/sites/example.com 3/opt/solr/bin/solr create_core -c upd_event -d drupal_solr_conf

item.title: Creating Solr Core
item.description: 1icasimpan@example.local:/opt/solr/bin$ sudo su solr -s /bin/bash 2solr@example.local:/opt/solr-6.6.2/bin$ /opt/solr/bin/solr create -c sample -p 8983 34Copying configuration to new core instance directory: 5/var/solr/data/sample 67Creating new core 'sample' using command: 8http://localhost:8983/solr/admin/cores?action=CREATE&name=cmoge&instanceDir=cmoge 910{ 11"responseHeader":{ 12"status":0, 13"QTime":686}, 14"core":"cmoge"} Then reload from the Web UI in https://example.local:8983/solr and you have the core running.

item.title: Define Solr Core in settings.local.php
item.description: 1$config['search_api.server.solr_events']['backend_config']['connector_config']['host'] = '68.193.132.102'; 2$config['search_api.server.solr_events']['backend_config']['connector_config']['port'] = '8983'; 3$config['search_api.server.solr_events']['backend_config']['connector_config']['core'] = 'upd_event'; 4$config['search_api.server.solr_news']['backend_config']['connector_config']['host'] = '68.193.132.102'; 5$config['search_api.server.solr_news']['backend_config']['connector_config']['port'] = '8983'; 6$config['search_api.server.solr_news']['backend_config']['connector_config']['core'] = 'upd_news'; 7$config['search_api.server.solr_search_site']['backend_config']['connector_config']['host'] = '68.193.132.102'; 8$config['search_api.server.solr_search_site']['backend_config']['connector_config']['port'] = '8983'; 9$config['search_api.server.solr_search_site']['backend_config']['connector_config']['core'] = 'upd_library'; 10$config['search_api.server.solr_publications']['backend_config']['connector_config']['host'] = '68.193.132.102'; 11$config['search_api.server.solr_publications']['backend_config']['connector_config']['port'] = '8983'; 12$config['search_api.server.solr_publications']['backend_config']['connector_config']['core'] = 'upd_publication'; As seen above, there's some config that hooks up drupal's host/port to solr core.
